com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api

Class TcrRenderView

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameLayout
      • com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api.TcrRenderView

  • public abstract class TcrRenderView
extends FrameLayout
    The rendering view, which is used to render the cloud image on the local device. An instance of this class is created by `com.tencent.tcr.sdk.plugin.impl.TcrSdkPlugin#createTcrRenderView(Context, TcrSession, TcrRenderViewType)`.

      渲染视图的模式

    • Method Detail

      • release

        public abstract void release()
        Release the underlying resources of the current view.
        You need to call this API to release underlying resources if the object is no longer needed, for example, when `Activity` is to be terminated. After release, the object can no longer be used.

      • createRenderView

        创建渲染视图
        Parameters:
        type - 渲染视图的类型
        Returns:
        视图

      • setOnTouchListener

        public void setOnTouchListener(View.OnTouchListener listener)
        Set the listener for the touch events of the view. Generally, two default implementations provided by the SDK are used:

        1. PcTouchHandler: Convert a tap event to a mouse event on a PC.

        2. MobileTouchHandler: Map a tap event on the local phone to a touchscreen operation on the cloud machine.

      • handleMotion

        public void handleMotion(MotionEvent event)
        Pass in the touch event. If you cannot or don't want to pass in events through the system view tree, you can use this method to pass in events to the `TcrRenderView` view. For example, if you use virtual keys (buttons), to avoid event conflicts due to multi-finger operations, you need to add a sibling layer to virtual keys (buttons) on the parent layout and make it fill the parent layout. The added sibling layer can be used as the delegate view of `TcrRenderView`. Directions: 1. Call `TcrRenderView.setOnTouchListener(null)` to disable the internal touch listener. 2. Set `OnTouchListener` for the delegate view, call `TcrRenderView.handleMotion(MotionEvent event)` in the `onTouch` function, and return `true`. Invoke TcrRenderView.handleMotion(MotionEvent event)，and return true
        Parameters:
        event - The touch event

      • setVideoRotation

        public abstract void setVideoRotation(VideoRotation rotation)
        Set the image rotation angle.
        Parameters:
        rotation - The image rotation angle

      • setVideoScaleType

        public abstract void setVideoScaleType(ScaleType type)
        Set the video scaling mode, which is `ScaleType.SCALE_ASPECT_FIT` by default.
        Parameters:
        type - The scaling mode to be set

      • enablePinch

        public void enablePinch(boolean enable)
        Set whether to allow two-finger pinch zoom on the game video image. The default value is `true`, and the image can be dragged when it is zoomed in.

        This API can take effect only if `PcTouchHandler` is set through `TcrRenderView#setOnTouchListener(OnTouchListener)` for the view.

        Parameters:
        enable - Valid values: `true`: yes; `false`: no.

      • setOnPinchListener

        public void setOnPinchListener(PinchListener listener)
        The two-finger pinch zoom listener, which listens for the two-finger pinch zoom parameter of the view.

        This API can take effect only if `PcTouchHandler` is set through `TcrRenderView#setOnTouchListener(OnTouchListener)` for the view.

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener

      • setPinchOffset

        public void setPinchOffset(Rect rect)
        Set the borders for dragging the zoomed image. After being zoomed, the view image can be dragged with two fingers even out of the original borders of the image. This API is used to set the borders for dragging.

        This API can take effect only if `PcTouchHandler` is set through `TcrRenderView#setOnTouchListener(OnTouchListener)` for the view.

        Parameters:
        rect - The bottom, top, left, and right margins between the borders for dragging and the original image borders (`PcTouchListener`)

      • resetView

        public void resetView()
        Reset the image. Reset the zoomed and dragged view.

        This API can take effect only if `PcTouchHandler` is set through `TcrRenderView#setOnTouchListener(OnTouchListener)` for the view.

      • showDebugView

        public abstract void showDebugView(boolean show)
        Enable the debugging mode to display the debugging information. The debugging information includes performance data, version information, encoding type, and key and touch information.
        Parameters:
        show - Valid values: `true`: Enable the view; `false`: Disable the view.

      • onLayout

        protected void onLayout(boolean changed,
                        int left,
                        int top,
                        int right,
                        int bottom)

      • setCursorVisibility

        public void setCursorVisibility(boolean visible)
        Set the visibility of the current cursor. Note: This setting only affects the visibility of the cursor locally, this setting does not affect the state of the cursor in the cloud
        Parameters:
        visible - true cursor showing , false cursor hidden

      • setCursorImage

        public void setCursorImage(Bitmap cursorBitmap,
                           int cursorSize)
        Set the cursor image.
        Parameters:
        cursorBitmap - The bitmap of the cursor image
        cursorSize - The calculated cursor size, which is the size of pixels to be displayed on the phone.

      • setCursorPos

        public void setCursorPos(int x,
                         int y)
        Set the absolute position of the cursor on the mobile phone.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate
        y - The Y coordinate

      • enableSuperResolution

        public abstract void enableSuperResolution(boolean enable)
        Enable video super-resolution capability. After turning it on, it will use the phone GPU to process the video stream to enhance the resolution

        Note:This method only works in api level 21 or above.

        Parameters:
        enable - true: open super-resolution false:close super-resolution
